item.title: Curriculum Vitae
item.description: Marie VAUGOYEAU Skills Field skills on birds and reptiles Lab skills Vertebrates’ manipulation Language Computer skills Experiences 2016-2017 1-year teaching assistant in biostatistics. Laboratory Mer, Molécules, Santé. EA 2160. Le Mans University 2014-2015 1-year teaching assistant in ecology and evolution. Laboratory Ecology, Systematic, Evolution, Paris-Sud University. 2011-2014 PhD student in ecology and evolution. Maternal effects as mediators of climate changes: mechanisms and consequences in avian populations. Evolutionary ecology department, iEES-Paris.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Ph.D. in Ecology and Evolution Since 2011, I work in ecology and especially I study influence of urbanised world on ecosystems. I am interesting by statistics and R-used. Contact: marie.vaugoyeau@gmail.com Twitter LinkedIn

item.title: First post
item.description: My first post My first post It is not easy to start, the first step is the hardest… I created this site to explain statistical analyses and used of R that I already did. It is also intended to evolve with my future works. See you.
